00071 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00072 
00073 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00074 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00075 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00076 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00077 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00078 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00079 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00080 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00081 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)

00083 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00084 
00085 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00086 
00087 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00088 
00089 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00090 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00092 
00093 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00094 
00095     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00096 }
00097 
00098 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00099 
00100 {
00101     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00102     spl_t flags;
00103 
00104     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00105 
00106     adeos_load_cpuid();
00107 
00108     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00109         {
00110         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00111             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00112         }
00113     else
00114         flags |= 2;
00115 
00116     return flags;
00117 }
00118 
00119 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00120 
00121 {
00122     if (!(flags & 2))
00123         {
00124         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00125 
00126         rthal_cli();
00127 
00128         adeos_load_cpuid();
00129 
00130         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00131             {
00132             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00133             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00134             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00135             }
00136         }
00137 
00138     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00139 }
00140 
00141 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00142 
00143 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00144 
00145 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00146 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00147 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00148 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00149 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00150 
00151 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00153 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS

00155 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00156 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00157 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00158 /* Using 2/3 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00159    experimentation that proved to fit on tested PPC platforms with
00160    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00161    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00162    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00163 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 2 / 3)

00203 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00204 
00205     /* Kernel mode side */
00206 
00207 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00208     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00209        and SPE are not available to kernel-based Xenomai threads. */
00210     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00211     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00212 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00213 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00214 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00215 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00216 
00217     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00218     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00219     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00220     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00221 
00222     /* User mode side */
00223     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00224     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00225 
00226     /* Init block */
00227     struct xnthread *self;
00228     int imask;
00229     const char *name;
00230     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00231     void *cookie;
00232 
00233 } xnarchtcb_t;

00249 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00250     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00251 }
00252 
00253 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00254     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00255 }
00256 
00257 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00258     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00259 }
00260 
00261 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00262     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00263 }
00264 
00265 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00266     return adeos_processor_id();
00267 }

00273 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00274 do { \
00275     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00276     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00277     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00278     for (;;) ;                          \
00279 } while(0)

00284 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00285 
00286 {
00287     spl_t s;
00288     splhigh(s);
00289     splexit(!!imask);
00290     return !!s;
00291 }

00295 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00296                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00297                                                    void *cookie),
00298                                    void *cookie)
00299 {
00300     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00301 
00302     if (!err)
00303         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00304 
00305     return err;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00309 
00310     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00311 }
00312 
00313 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00314 
00315 {
00316     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00317         return -EINVAL;
00318 
00319     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00320 
00321     return 0;
00322 }
00323 
00324 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00325 
00326 {
00327     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00328         return -EINVAL;
00329 
00330     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00331 
00332     return 0;
00333 }
00334

00336     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00337 }
00338 
00339 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00340     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00341 }

00343 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00344 
00345     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00346 }

00357 void xnpod_welcome_thread(struct xnthread *);

00360 
00361 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00362 
00363 {
00364 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00365     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00366 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00367     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00368        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00369     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00370 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00371 }
00372 
00373 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00374                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00375     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00376 }
00377 
00378 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00379 
00380 {
00381     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00382 
00383     adeos_load_cpuid();
00384 
00385     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00386        and always inside a critical section. */
00387     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00388     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00389     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00390     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00391 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00392     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00393 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00394 }
00395 
00396 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00397     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00398 }
00399 
00400 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00401                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00402 {
00403     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00404     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00405     unsigned long flags;
00406 
00407     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00408 
00409     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00410 
00411     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00412         {
00413         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00414         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00415 
00416         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00417 
00418         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00419 
00420         if (prev != next)
00421             {
00422             get_mmu_context(next);
00423             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00424             }
00425 
00426         if (!inproc->mm)
00427             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00428 
00429         /* The following has been lifted from
00430            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00431 
00432 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00433         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00434             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00435 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00436         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00437             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00438 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00439 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00440         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00441             giveup_spe(outproc);
00442 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00443 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00444 
00445 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00446         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00447             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00448 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00449 
00450 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00451         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00452             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00453 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00454 
00455         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00456         }
00457     else
00458         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00459         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00460 
00461     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00462 }
00463 
00464 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00465                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00466     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00467 }
00468 
00469 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00470     /* Empty */
00471 }
00472 
00473 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00474 
00475 {
00476 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00477 
00478     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00479 
00480     if (task)
00481         {
00482         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00483             giveup_fpu(task);
00484 
00485         return;
00486         }
00487 
00488     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00489 
00490     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00491 
00492 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00493 }
00494 
00495 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00496 
00497 {
00498 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00499 
00500     if (tcb->user_task)
00501         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00502            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00503            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00504         return;
00505 
00506     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00507 
00508     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00509 
00510 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00511 }
00512 
00513 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00514                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00515                                          const char *name)
00516 {
00517     tcb->user_task = current;
00518     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00519     tcb->ksp = 0;
00520     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00521 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00522     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00523 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00524     tcb->entry = NULL;
00525     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00526     tcb->self = thread;
00527     tcb->imask = 0;
00528     tcb->name = name;
00529 }
00530 
00531 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00532 
00533     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00534     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00535     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00536 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00537     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00538 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00539     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00540 }
00541 
00542 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00543 
00544 {
00545     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00546     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00547     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00548     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00549 }
00550 
00551 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00552                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00553                                        void *cookie,
00554                                        int imask,
00555                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00556                                        char *name)
00557 {
00558     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00559 
00560     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00561 
00562     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00563     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00564     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00565     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00566     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00567     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00568 
00569     tcb->entry = entry;
00570     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00571     tcb->self = thread;
00572     tcb->imask = imask;
00573     tcb->name = name;
00574 }
00575 
00576 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00577 
00578 {
00579 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00580     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00581        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00582     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00583     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00584 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00585 }
00586 
00587 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00588 
00589     while (!*flagp)
00590         {
00591         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00592         schedule_timeout(1);
00593         }
00594 }
00595 
00596 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00597 
00598 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00599 
00600     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00601 }
00602 
00603 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00604 
00605 {
00606     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00607                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00608                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00609                                      NULL,
00610                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00611 }
00612 
00613 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00614 
00615 {
00616     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00617                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00618                                      NULL,
00619                                      NULL,
00620                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00621 }
00622 
00623 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00624 
00625 {
00626     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00627     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00628 }
00629 
00630 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00631 
00632 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00633 
00634     return 0;
00635 }
00636 
00637 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00638 
00639     return 0;
00640 }
00641 
00642 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00643 
00644     return 0;
00645 }
00646 
00647 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00648 
00649 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00650 
00651 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00652 
00653 {
00654 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00655     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00656        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00657     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00658 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00659     xnshadow_release_events();
00660     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00661     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00662     schedule_timeout(50);
00663     xnarch_release_ipi();
00664 }
00665 
00666 static inline void xnarch_escalate (void) {
00667 
00668     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00669     adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00670 }
00671 
00672 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00673 
00674     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);
00675 }
00676 
00677 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00678 
00679     kfree(chunk);
00680 }
00681 
00682 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00683     
00684     xnshadow_grab_events();
00685 }
00686 
00687 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00688 
00689 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00690 
00691 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00692                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00693                                            const char *name)
00694 {
00695     struct task_struct *task = current;
00696 
00697     tcb->user_task = task;
00698     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00699     tcb->ksp = 0;
00700     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00701 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00702     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00703 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00704     tcb->entry = NULL;
00705     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00706     tcb->self = thread;
00707     tcb->imask = 0;
00708     tcb->name = name;
00709 }
00710 
00711 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00712 
00713 {
00714     unsigned irq;
00715 
00716     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00717         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00718                              handler,
00719                              NULL,
00720                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00721 
00722     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00723        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00724        individually. */
00725 
00726     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00727                          handler,
00728                          NULL,
00729                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00730 }
00731 
00732 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00733 
00734 {
00735     unsigned irq;
00736 
00737     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00738         {
00739         switch (irq)
00740             {
00741 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00742             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00743 
00744                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00745                 continue;
00746 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00747 
00748             default:
00749 
00750                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00751             }
00752         }
00753 
00754     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00755 }
00756 
00757 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00758 
00759 {
00760     unsigned irq;
00761 
00762     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00763         {
00764         switch (irq)
00765             {
00766 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00767             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00768 
00769                 continue;
00770 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00771 
00772             default:
00773 
00774                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00775             }
00776         }
00777 
00778     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00779 }
00780 
00781 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00782 
00783 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00784 
00785 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00786     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00787        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00788        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. Since the
00789        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00790        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */ 
00791     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00792 }
00793 
00794 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00795     rthal_release_timer();
00796 }
00797 
00798 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00799 
00800 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00801 
00802 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00803 
00804 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00805 
00806 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00807 
00808 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00809 
00810 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00811 
00812 {
00813     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00814     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00815     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00816 }
00817 
00818 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00819 
00820 {
00821 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00822     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00823        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00824     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00825 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00826 
00827     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00828 
00829     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00830         return -ENOSYS;
00831 
00832     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00833                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00834                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00835                               NULL,
00836                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00837 
00838     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00839 
00840     return xnshadow_init();
00841 }
00842 
00843 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00844 
00845     xnshadow_cleanup();
00846     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00847     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00848 }
00849 
00850 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00851 
00852 #ifdef __cplusplus
00853 }
00854 #endif

00862 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
